The Natural dyes are an absorbed dye whereby the cord is dipped in the dye, the cord absorbs the dye, and then the cord is heat sealed. Because the dye is absorbed rather than coated, the cord is softer and more flexible than regular cord. This process allows the natural color of the cord to come through. In some colors, it presents somewhat of a "tie-dye" look. All Natural dye colors present a "flat" color versus a shiny color.
This leather product is free of Lead, AZO’s, PCP, Mercury, Formaldehyde, Chromium VI, Cadmium and other carcinogenic/hazardous chemicals. It meets CPSIA standards. 
There is an industry tolerance of /- 0.3mm when manufacturing leather cording. This would mean that a 1mm cord can be as large as 1.3mm or as small as 0.7mm. Additionally, due to the natural properties of leather, leather can expand or contract according to the climate, moisture, heat and/or how it is stored. The hides themselves will also affect the size of the cord. Hides can, and do vary, in thickness, even those from the same animal.
I have lots of leather cord and clasps in my shop:
https://www.etsy.com/shop/SupplyYourSoul/search?search_query=leather&order=date_desc&view_type=gallery&ref=shop_search
Leather cord is produced from cowhides - and the hide eventually ends and a new one begins.  Some companies splice together the cords, which produces an invisible, but weak connection.  My manufacturer chooses not to disguise the connection - and simply ties the two ends together.  If the tied end occurs in the length that I am cutting for you, I will add an additional yard of cord to your order, free of charge.

Product name: Birthday Tutu, Rainbow Tutu, Sewn Tutu, Baby Tutu, Newborn Tutu, Toddler Tutu, Tutu, Rainbow, Tutu, Cakesmash Tutu, Photoprop, Easter Tutu
Description:
Very full, extra fluffy, boutique~style,  sewn tutu in rainbow colors with a hot pink satin bow. 
This tutu is super full and fluffy. All tutu sizes have the same amount of fullness, the only difference between them is the length. I offer multiple lengths that are standard for each size. If you prefer a different length than is listed here, please message me for a custom listing.
I recommend measuring your little ones' waist size, prior to placing an order. My tutus are made with a stretchy, non-roll, elastic waistband. The waistbands on my tutus are made to fit snugly on the waist but also to comfortably stretch several inches larger (to allow for ease of dressing and pulling over any clothing, if necessary). This will also allow your child to grow with the tutu and will extend the length of time the tutu can be worn. When measuring waist size for your tutu, please wrap measuring tape along natural waist (right above hip bones). Do not measure over bulky clothing and be sure the measuring tape is sitting snug along the waist but not binding (for accurate measurement).
When deciding on a tutu length, it is important to note that the shorter a tutu is, the more the tulle will fluff out instead of hang down. This is especially true for the shorter tutus. The numeric length shown for the shorter tutus (6 or 8 inches) is the tulle length used for the skirt, not necessarily how long the tutu actually is (since the tulle will fluff out). The longer tutus are usually closer to measurements for length (10 inches and longer).
I offer the following standard waist measurements for each size:
Size 0-6 months~13/14 inch waist
6 inch length
Size 6-12 months~16 inch waist
6 or 8 inch length
Size 12-24 months (1-2 years)~18 inch waist
6, 8 or 10 inch length
